DataElement.preferredName: Local Study Site Radiation Dosimetry Plan Compliance Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Yes No indicator to specify whether a local study site is able to follow the standard radiation dosimetry plan

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Local Study Site Radiation Dosimetry Plan Compliance
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Of or belonging to a restricted area or locality._A facility in which study/protocol activities are conducted._Voluntary cooperation of the patient in following a prescribed regimen._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria._Voluntary cooperation of the patient in following a prescribed regimen._The measurement of radiation by photography, as in x-ray film and film badge, by Geiger-Mueller tube, and by scintillation counting._A systematic statement of policy rules or principles. Guidelines may be developed by government agencies at any level, institutions, professional societies, governing boards, or by convening expert panels._To devise, contrive, or form in design.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Of or belonging to a restricted area or locality.:A facility in which study/protocol activities are conducted.:The measurement of radiation by photography, as in x-ray film and film badge, by Geiger-Mueller tube, and by scintillation counting.

Concepts.definition: Of or belonging to a restricted area or locality.
A facility in which study/protocol activities are conducted.
The measurement of radiation by photography, as in x-ray film and film badge, by Geiger-Mueller tube, and by scintillation counting.

Property.preferredDefinition: Directions or principles presenting current or future rules of policy. Guidelines may be developed by government agencies at any level, institutions, professional societies, governing boards, or by the convening of expert panels. The text may be cursive or in outline form but is generally a comprehensive guide to problems and approaches in any field of activity. For guidelines in the field of health care and clinical medicine, PRACTICE GUIDELINES is available.:To devise, contrive, or form in design.:Voluntary cooperation of the patient in following a prescribed regimen.

Concepts.definition: A systematic statement of policy rules or principles. Guidelines may be developed by government agencies at any level, institutions, professional societies, governing boards, or by convening expert panels.
To devise, contrive, or form in design.
Voluntary cooperation of the patient in following a prescribed regimen.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016
